content.description: Source: United States Office of Personnel Management, 2016.
content.question: Which of the following best describes how a president can influence the data in the graphs?

choices.label: Through the role of chief executive officer of the executive branch, the president can determine salary grades of federal employees.
The president has the power to formally introduce appropriations bills in the House of Representatives which can determine salary grades of federal employees.
The president as commander in chief can issue executive orders to modify the salary grades of federal employees.
The president has the authority to issue signing statements to determine the salary grades of federal employees.

content.answer: Through the role of chief executive officer of the executive branch, the president can determine salary grades of federal employees.
